section-body.paragraph-text: Fertilizer compositions containing phosphorus in any organic or inorganic form, processes and apparatus for obtaining them.
Treating manure; apparatus for distributing fertiliser A01C.
Any apparatus for preparing fertilisers may be classified in those areas of C05 that are specific for such apparatus – e.g., C05B1/10 – apparatus for the manufacture of superphosphates.
Otherwise, individual apparatus should be classified in the relevant area of the IPC, e.g., F26B7/00.

table-column.paragraph-text: Nitrogenous fertilisers
Inorganic fertilisers not covered by subclasses C05B, C05C; fertilisers producing carbon dioxide
Organic fertilisers not covered by subclasses C05B, C05C, e.g. fertilisers from waste or refuse

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Harrows with means for distributing fertilisers
Fertlisers distributors
Mowers combined with dispensing apparatus, e.g. for fertilisers
Horticulture; cultivation of vegetables, flowers, rice, fruit, vines, hops or seaweed; forestry; watering
Root feeders; injecting fertilisers into roots
Phosphorus; compounds thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: An ingredient in a mixture of fertilisers, or a single fertiliser which contains more that one of the chemical elements on which the subdivision is based, is classified only in the first of the appropriate places. Thus, a nitrophosphate or an ammoniated superphosphate is classified in C05B but not in C05C, magnesium phosphate is classified in C05B but not in C05D, and calcium cyanamide in C05C but not in C05D.
Information relative to the form in which the fertilizer is presented, e.g. granulation, coating, etc. is always given in addition to the chemical composition of the fertilizers.

Any ingredient in a mixture, which is considered to present information of interest for search, is also classified using a combination of classification symbols. If a document concerns embodiments comprising mixtures whose elements are covered individually by different subclasses, groups or subgroups, the document is classified with a Combination-set.

list-item.paragraph-text: The first element of the Combination-set corresponds to the first relevant (sub)group mentioned in the classification scheme independently of the importance or relevance of the element in the whole fertilizer mixture;
the following element or elements of the Combination_set are added sequentially in the order in which they appear in the classification scheme to the first element using a ",".

section-body.paragraph-text: Example: a fertilizer containing a mixture of superphosphate (C05B1/02), ammonium nitrate (C05C1/00) and potassium chloride (C05D1/02) will be given the Combination-set C05B1/02, C05C1/00, C05D1/02.

Example: a fertilizer containing a mixture of either superphosphate (C05B1/02) or ammonium nitrate (C05C1/00) with potassium chloride (C05D1/02) will be given the Combination-set C05B1/02, C05D1/02 and C05C1/00, C05D1/02.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fertiliser (fertiliser material)
Natural or artificial substance containing the chemical elements that improve growth and productiveness of plants.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: "enrichment"
"fertiliser"
"soil amendment"
" composition capable of modifying the chemical (pH) or physical (structure) condition of soils for agricultural purposes".

definition-item.definition-title: Superphosphates, i.e. fertilisers produced by reacting rock or bone phosphates with sulfuric or phosphoric acid in such amounts and concentrations as to yield solid products directly

section-body.paragraph-text: Fertilisers produced by reacting rock or bone phosphates with sulphuric or phosphoric acid in such amounts and concentrations as to yield solid products directly and apparatus for their manufacture.

table-column.paragraph-text: Fertilizers based essentially on ammonium orthophosphate

definition-item.definition-title: Fertilisers based essentially on di-calcium phosphate (C05B11/00 takes precedence)

table-column.paragraph-text: Di calcium phosphate fertilisers produced by wet treating raw materials with acids or alkalis

section-body.paragraph-text: Fertilizers obtained from phosphate containing slags, waste or by products of metallurgical processes with fertilizer value.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Thomas phosphate; Thomas slag
slag calcium phosphate obtained in steelmaking converters from pig iron with high phosphorus acid content

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Fertilisers based essentially on alkali or ammonium orthophosphates (C05B11/00 takes precedence)

table-column.paragraph-text: Alkali or ammonium orthophosphates produced by wet or leach treatment with acids or alkalis

definition-item.definition-title: Fertilisers based essentially on phosphates or double phosphates of magnesium (C05B11/00 takes precedence)

table-column.paragraph-text: Fertilisers based essentially on phosphates or double phosphates of magnesium produced by wet or leach treatment with acids or alkalis

definition-item.definition-title: Fertilisers produced by pyrogenic processes from phosphatic materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Fertilisers produced by pyrogenic processes from phosphatic materials like rock phosphates or metallic phosphorus compounds such as to rend polyphosphate fertilisers.
This group mainly contains polyphosphates, and also any other fertilizers produced from pyrogenic processes from phosphate fertilizers

table-column.paragraph-text: Bone meal

definition-item.definition-title: Other phosphatic fertilisers, e.g. soft rock phosphates, bone meal

section-body.paragraph-text: Other phosphatic fertilisers not classified in the previous groups, e.g. soft rock phosphates, bone meal, phosphite fertilisers.

definition-item.definition-title: Granulation or pelletisation of phosphatic fertilisers, other than slag (granulating apparatus B01J2/00; granulating slag C04B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Exclusively granulation or pelletisation of fertilizers belonging to any of the groups C05B.

table-column.paragraph-text: Granulating apparatus
Granulating slag
Process in general for granulating fertilizers
